channel.title: RSPS Help - Please reply
channel.description: Hello, im currently creating a 718 Runescape Private Server. I'm still working on some things but i've run into some problems. I've Jared my client recently but for some reason it won't work this time. I've followed a video on youtube. I've opened JarMaker, I created a folder on my desktop called Webclient and selected that as my output directory. I named my client ServerName.jar. After selecting my output directory I changed the input directory. My input directory was Desktop/Server/Webclient/Bin. My input was my BIN in the webclient folder. After doing these steps I create my Manifest Template. Since the server was 718 I put my Manifest to Loader. I then went into my client and opened Loader.java. I created a NO-IP and changed the 127.0.0.0 ip to my NO-IP address that I created. I checked my port forwarding and everything was done correctly. My port was set to 43594. After doing all of these steps I Jared the client and sent it to a friend through skype. He opened the webclient but all that was there was a screen saying "Checking for updates 0%" and it stayed there and never went up. Someone please reply to this and help me out. I do have skype and a working mic so if you'd like to speak with me I can also do that.

item.title: RSPS Help - Please reply
item.dc:creator: @nervo nervo
item.description:
@nervo wrote:

brennan1150:

Hello, im currently creating a 718 Runescape Private Server. I’m still working on some things but i’ve run into some problems. I’ve Jared my client recently but for some reason it won’t work this time. I’ve followed a video on youtube. I’ve opened JarMaker, I created a folder on my desktop called Webclient and selected that as my output directory. I named my client ServerName.jar. After selecting my output directory I changed the input directory. My input directory was Desktop/Server/Webclient/Bin. My input was my BIN in the webclient folder. After doing these steps I create my Manifest Template. Since the server was 718 I put my Manifest to Loader. I then went into my client and opened Loader.java. I created a NO-IP and changed the 127.0.0.0 ip to my NO-IP address that I created. I checked my port forwarding and everything was done correctly. My port was set to 43594. After doing all of these steps I Jared the client and sent it to a friend through skype. He opened the webclient but all that was there was a screen saying “Checking for updates 0%” and it stayed there and never went up. Someone please reply to this and help me out. I do have skype and a working mic so if you’d like to speak with me I can also do that.

Hey friend use this tutorial. http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/rs-503-client-server/tutorials/396130-working-667-webclient.html

Read full topic

item.title: RSPS Help - Please reply
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

brennan1150:

Hello, im currently creating a 718 Runescape Private Server. I’m still working on some things but i’ve run into some problems. I’ve Jared my client recently but for some reason it won’t work this time. I’ve followed a video on youtube. I’ve opened JarMaker, I created a folder on my desktop called Webclient and selected that as my output directory. I named my client ServerName.jar. After selecting my output directory I changed the input directory. My input directory was Desktop/Server/Webclient/Bin. My input was my BIN in the webclient folder. After doing these steps I create my Manifest Template. Since the server was 718 I put my Manifest to Loader. I then went into my client and opened Loader.java. I created a NO-IP and changed the 127.0.0.0 ip to my NO-IP address that I created. I checked my port forwarding and everything was done correctly. My port was set to 43594. After doing all of these steps I Jared the client and sent it to a friend through skype. He opened the webclient but all that was there was a screen saying “Checking for updates 0%” and it stayed there and never went up. Someone please reply to this and help me out. I do have skype and a working mic so if you’d like to speak with me I can also do that.

This could possibly be an auto cache-downloading problem. Make sure all of the links are correct.

Read full topic
